item.description:
Join us for a visit to the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis Univ. The museum has over 8,000 works of art including pieces by de Kooning, Jasper Johns, Lichtenstein, Andy Warhol and many, many others. It is particularly strong in American art of the 60's and 70's. The museum is scheduled to close this summer, so come join us for a visit! Admission is free!

When enter the Brandeis Campus through the main entrance, take a left. You will pass the admissions building and the round Spingold Theatre building, both on your left. The Rose Art Museum will be on your left. We will meet inside the main entrance. Look for Catherine who will be wearing/carrying a bright green coat.


Parking for The Rose is located in the front of the museum. In the event that there are no available spaces, visitors may also park in Hassenfeld Lot, behind the museum to the right. All parking requires a Brandeis parking pass, which can be acquired at the front desk of the museum.

We may head to a late lunch after.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Catherine (see photo) inside ent. If need to, please call 774 232 0000
item.name: Visit the Rose Art Museum at Brandeis Univ. Free Admission
